SEARCH

Class HotelReservationSystem

java.lang.Object
HotelReservationSystem
public class HotelReservationSystem extends Object
HotelReservationSystem is a class that manages an arraylist of hotels and provides methods for creating, viewing, managing hotels and creating reservations.
Version:
26/06/24 - 4:30AM

    • displayHotels

      public void displayHotels()
      Prints out the names of each Hotel in the Reservation System along with a corresponding index.

    • addHotel

      private void addHotel(Hotel hotel)
      Adds a new Hotel into the Reservation System.
      Parameters:
      hotel - the hotel to add

    • createHotel

      private void createHotel()
      Creates a new hotel in the system. This method prompts the user to enter the necessary information to create a new hotel, including:
      • Hotel name
      • Room prefix
      • Initial room amount (between 1 and 50)
      • Optional: custom room price per night (at least 100.00)
      The method checks for duplicate hotel names and prefixes, and ensures that the user enters valid input for each field. Once the user has entered all the necessary information, a new Hotel object is created and added to the system.
      See Also:
      • Hotel(String, int, String)
      • Hotel(String, int, String, double)
      • addHotel(Hotel)

    • viewHotel

      private void viewHotel()
      Views information about a hotel in the system. This method allows the user to select a hotel to view and then choose the type of information to display. The user is first prompted to select a hotel from the list of available hotels. Then, they are presented with a menu to choose the type of information to view, which includes:
      • High-level information (hotel name, room amount, earnings for the month)
      • Low-level room availability
      • Specific room information
      • Specific reservation details
      The method uses a do-while loop to repeatedly prompt the user for input until they choose a valid option.
      See Also:
      • displayHotels()
      • highLevelInformation(int)
      • Hotel.lowLevelRoomAvailability()
      • Hotel.lowLevelRoomInformation()
      • Hotel.lowLevelReservationDetails()

    • manageHotel

      private void manageHotel()
      Manages a hotel in the system. This method allows the user to select a hotel to manage and then perform various operations on it, such as:
      • Renaming the hotel
      • Adding rooms to the hotel
      • Removing empty rooms from the hotel
      • Updating the base price of the rooms in the hotel
      • Removing a reservation from the hotel
      • Removing the hotel from the system
      The method uses a do-while loop to repeatedly prompt the user for input until they choose a valid option.
      See Also:
      • displayHotels()
      • Hotel.setHotelName(String)
      • Hotel.addRooms()
      • Hotel.removeRooms()
      • Hotel.changePricePerNight()
      • Hotel.removeReservation()

    • highLevelInformation

      private void highLevelInformation(int hotelIndex)
      Displays high-level information about a Hotel, including its name, Room amount, and Estimated Earnings for the Month.
      Parameters:
      hotelIndex - the index of the hotel to display information for

    • createReservation

      private void createReservation()
      Collects data needed to create a reservation and passes it to another method named createReservation under the Hotel Class. Link to method createReservation Hotel.createReservation()

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point of the Hotel Reservation System application. This method creates a new instance of the HotelReservationSystem class and a Scanner object to read user input. It then displays a menu to the user, allowing them to select one of the following options:
      • Create a new hotel
      • View existing hotels
      • Manage an existing hotel
      • Simulate a booking
      • Exit the system
      The method uses a do-while loop to repeatedly prompt the user for input until they choose to exit the system.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments (not used in this implementation)
